channel.title: nautilus on Goofing Osamu
channel.description: Recent content in nautilus on Goofing Osamu

item.title: Files (nautilus)
item.description: This is based on nautilus version 43.2 in 2023. Gnome Files “Gnome Files” (a.k.a nautilus) is the default file manager for GNOME desktop environment. It is rather a simple file manager with primitive functionalities, but it can be extended to offer rich features. I consider following packages as essential and installed these: nautilus-extension-gnome-terminal (recommended by gnome-terminal) python3-nautilus (needed to support extensions) nautilus-image-converter I am interested but doing without these packages to keep things simple:
